intro: Teucrium polium var. laxum, commonly known as the laxum germander, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its small, clustered flowers are usually pink to purple, blooming in summer, and it is often found in rocky or limestone soils. This variety is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
